text: To whom is the Gospel of Luke addressed?
verseText: it seemed good to me also, having followed all things closely for some time past, to write an orderly account for you, most excellent Theophilus,

text: Luke's Gospel provides a detailed account of what event not found in Matthew or Mark?
options: The birth and childhood of John the Baptist and Jesus
verseText: (Luke chapters 1 and 2 contain unique details about the announcements, births, and early lives of both John the Baptist and Jesus).

text: Luke emphasizes Jesus' concern for which groups of people?
options: The poor, outcasts, women, Samaritans, Gentiles
verseText: (Luke highlights Jesus' compassion and ministry towards marginalized groups often overlooked in society).

text: Which famous parable, unique to Luke, tells of a son who squanders his inheritance but is welcomed back by his father?
options: The Parable of the Good Samaritan
The Parable of the Prodigal Son
verseText: And he said, “There was a man who had two sons. And the younger of them said to his father, ‘Father, give me the share of property that is coming to me.’ And he divided his property between them...

text: Luke's genealogy of Jesus (Luke 3) traces Jesus' ancestry back to whom?
verseText: ...the son of Enos, the son of Seth, the son of Adam, the son of God.

text: What other New Testament book did the author of Luke write?
verseText: In the first book, O Theophilus, I have dealt with all that Jesus began to do and teach,

text: In Luke 10, Jesus tells the Parable of the Good Samaritan in response to what question?
options: 'What must I do to be saved?'
verseText: But he, desiring to justify himself, said to Jesus, “And who is my neighbor?”

text: Luke's account of the Last Supper includes Jesus' words instituting the cup and bread, and also a prediction of betrayal and what dispute among the disciples?
options: Who would pay for the meal
Who was the greatest among them
verseText: A dispute also arose among them, as to which of them was to be regarded as the greatest.

text: On the road to Emmaus (Luke 24), the resurrected Jesus explains what to two disciples?
options: How the Scriptures (Old Testament) pointed to his suffering and glory
The structure of the early church
verseText: And beginning with Moses and all the Prophets, he interpreted to them in all the Scriptures the things concerning himself.

text: Luke often emphasizes the role of...
verseText: (Luke frequently mentions the Holy Spirit's activity and Jesus' or others' engagement in prayer).
